poem:
### The Coup

Against the quiet  
corridors of power,  
voices clashed like  
starlings at dusk.

An agenda's  
sharp pivot,  
meeting turned skirmish—  
winds shifting.  

Beneath the fluorescent hum,  
titles tumbled  
in bureaucratic ruin.

Paper whispers  
of departure,  
echoing back:  
this was no ordinary day.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Make no mistake – this was a coup’: the extraordinary downfall of the BBC’s top bosses default When Deborah Turness, the now departed BBC News chief, was first invited to a meeting with the corporation’s board a few weeks ago, there was little to suggest it would be a particularly significant encounter. But instead of a routine meeting, she came under attack over an item added to the agenda. The lengthy confrontation that followed set". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
